title: [K-12] Optimized Design for Project-Based Learning Integrated with Design Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and fundamental project management concepts
context.additional_context: Intensive short-term course focusing on science project development using digital devices and applying design thinking methodologies

learning_goals: Learners can apply the five stages of design thinking (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test) to create a project design document in the field of science

In a 2–4-week project-based learning process, learners request feedback from ≥3 peers, present improvements incorporating ≥4/5 feedbacks in team meetings, and achieve an average peer evaluation score of ≥4.0/5.0.
Learners develop prototypes for scientific problem-solving and achieve over 80% completion of the final output through effectiveness verification
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
